content: this is the sweater for those moody fall walks when the air has turned crisp and the dark comes earlier inspired by the oversized grungy looks of the 90s i wanted a cardigan i could just throw over a dress or maybe an old band tee and chinos pleated of course this top-down sweater in a chunky yarn makes for a quick knit that can be tried on along the way the inset pockets added halfway down the body preserve the lines of the ribbing the half fisherman s rib pattern creates an easy rhythm for knitting while rewatching your favorite rom-com this sweater is great fresh off the needles but feel free to wear it to the ground just like that favorite sweater from your teens construction method this cardigan is worked in half fisherman s rib in one piece from the top down stitches for sleeves are placed on hold while working the body pockets are worked into to the fronts stitches are picked up for buttonbands and neckband sizes women s xs s m l 1x 2x 3x 4x 5x shown in size l with 6 inches/15 cm of ease at chest finished measurements chest circumference at underarm with buttonbands overlapped 34 75 38 75 42 75 46 75 49 25 54 75 57 25 61 25 66 75 inches/ 88 5 98 5 108 5 118 5 125 139 145 5 155 5 169 5 cm length at center back not including neckband 19 5 20 21 21 21 5 22 22 5 22 5 23 inches/ 49 5 51 53 5 53 5 54 5 56 57 57 58 5 cm materials yarn spacer berroco ultra alpaca chunky 50% super fine alpaca 50% peruvian wool 131 yd/120 m per 3 5 oz/100 g skein color #7204 buckwheat 7 8 8 9 10 11 12 13 14 skeins yarn characteristics spacer the sample shown uses a chunky-weight 2-ply blend of wool and alpaca the alpaca fiber s warmth and softness are balanced by stability from the wool the heather dye and the slight fuzz of this yarn soften the look of the ribbed stitch pattern recommended needle size always use a needle size that gives you the gauge listed below - every knitter s gauge is unique 1 us #8/5mm circular needle 32-inch/80-cm long 1 us #10/6mm circular needle 32-inch/80-cm long 1 us #10/6mm circular needle 16-inch/40-cm long 1 set s us #8/5mm double-pointed needles notions stitch markers waste yarn to hold stitches 9 1-inch buttons yarn needle gauge 12 sts/32 row or rounds as applicable = 4 inches/10 cm in half fisherman s rib note gauge is always taken after blocking
